description_narrative: Restore and/or strengthen responsive, accountable and inclusive core governance functions at the national and local levels in fragile and crisis-affected settings to help (re)build an inclusive social contract, ensure effective service delivery and restore public trust in core governance institutions that leave no one behind.
conditions_condition_narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
result_indicator_title_narrative: Number of UNDP global frameworks, guidance documents, and tools on strengthening resilient centre of government institutions in fragile and crisis-affected contexts developed and shared to support policy and programming

Number of countries provided with technical assistance and advisory services to (re)build resilient, conflict-sensitive, effective and accountable core government institutional at the national level  in fragile and conflict-affected environments

Number of South-South Cooperation exchanges, sharing practices documented,,  peer-to-peer learning, and knowledge sharing activities to sustain and scale practices on strengthening resilient centres of government institutions
Number of guidance documents, frameworks and tools developed and shared with fragile and conflict-affected countries on local governance

Number of countries provided with technical assistance and advisory services to (re)build resilient, conflict-sensitive and gender-responsive local governance systems and processes in fragile and conflict-affected environments

Number of South-South Cooperation exchanges, sharing practices documented, peer-to-peer learning, and knowledge sharing activities to sustain and scale practices on strengthening resilient local governance systems and processes
Number of high-level and technical events that elevate issues of Core Government Functions to global policy debates and promote UNDP thought leadership.

Number of corporate-level partnerships between UNDP and other UN Agencies, regional and international organizations, bilateral agencies,  IFIs, civil society, academia and other non-state actor developed and supported
Number of innovative global initiatives  on CGFs undertaken by UNDP or in partnership with other stakeholders, including co-created, experimental and adaptive policy and programming approaches
result_indicator_description_narrative:
4.1.1 Number of UNDP global guidance documents on strengthening resilient centers of government in fragile and crisis-affected contexts developed and shared to support policy and programming
4.1.2 Number of fragile and conflict-affected countries that have adapted and/or applied the Core Government Functions guidance materials on strengthening resilient centers of government
4.1.3. Number of countries able to apply technical assistance and advisory services to (re)build resilient centers of government in fragile and conflict-affected environments
4.1.4. Number of South-South Cooperation Exchanges as part of peer-to-peer learning on strengthening resilient centers of government
4.2.1. Number of fragile and conflict-affected countries that have adapted and/or applied the Core Government Functions guidance materials on local governance
4.2.2. Number of countries able to apply technical assistance and advisory services to (re)build resilient, gender-responsive local governance systems and processes in fragile and conflict-affected environments
4.2.3. Number of South-South Cooperation Exchanges as part of peer-to-peer learning on strengthening resilient local governance systems and processes
4.3.1 Number of conflict-affected countries where joint analysis is undertaken using the UN-WB Diagnostic Assessment Tool on Core Government Functions under the auspices of the UN Interagency Platform for Strengthening Core Government Functions in Fragile and Crisis-affected Settings
4.3.2. Number of joint programmes and other interventions between UNDP and the World Bank at country levels
4.3.3. Number of corporate-level partnership collaborations between UNDP and other UN Agencies, regional and international organizations, other IFIs, civil society, academia and other non-state actor
4.4.1. Number of innovative global knowledge pieces on CGFs undertaken by UNDP or in partnership with other stakeholders, including the rule of law in public administration project and gender-responsi

Number of UNDP global frameworks, guidance documents, and tools on strengthening resilient centre of government institutions in fragile and crisis-affected contexts developed and shared to support policy and programming

Number of countries provided with technical assistance and advisory services to (re)build resilient, conflict-sensitive, effective and accountable core government institutional at the national level  in fragile and conflict-affected environments

Number of South-South Cooperation exchanges, sharing practices documented,,  peer-to-peer learning, and knowledge sharing activities to sustain and scale practices on strengthening resilient centres of government institutions
Number of guidance documents, frameworks and tools developed and shared with fragile and conflict-affected countries on local governance

Number of countries provided with technical assistance and advisory services to (re)build resilient, conflict-sensitive and gender-responsive local governance systems and processes in fragile and conflict-affected environments

Number of South-South Cooperation exchanges, sharing practices documented, peer-to-peer learning, and knowledge sharing activities to sustain and scale practices on strengthening resilient local governance systems and processes
Number of high-level and technical events that elevate issues of Core Government Functions to global policy debates and promote UNDP thought leadership.

Number of corporate-level partnerships between UNDP and other UN Agencies, regional and international organizations, bilateral agencies,  IFIs, civil society, academia and other non-state actor developed and supported
Number of innovative global initiatives  on CGFs undertaken by UNDP or in partnership with other stakeholders, including co-created, experimental and adaptive policy and programming approaches
result_indicator_baseline_comment_narrat: UNDP support core government functions in over 80 countries. There is one guidance on core government functions overall and one note on local governance.
result_indicator_period_actual_comment_n:
Libya, Zimbabwe, Algeria, and Guinea Bissau have been supported to apply CGF materials for centre of government work. 

Facilitated a south-south exchange with the Addis regional hub across the Africa region on legitimacy and service delivery; Joint UNDP-Emergency Governance Initiative (LSE, UCLG, Metropolis) South-South exchange on how to support Multi-Level Governance in crisis-affected settings, with participation of 9 countries (Nepal, Pakistan, Iraq, Tunisia, Kenya (Mandera Triangle Borderlands region), Nigeria (Lake Chad Borderlands region), Uzbekistan, Ukraine and Colombia), organized at LSE in June 2021 

Central African Republic, Iraq, Philippines and Lebanon have been supported to apply CGF materials for local governance 

The UN and World Bank with the Policy Center for the New South collaborated on a series of public debates in Morocco called “Parlons Développement”.

Joint tool developed on local governments and refugees with UNHCR; Joint tool on governance and migration developed with IOM; Joint training developed and online with UNICEF on Local Governance and Sustaining Peace

Started research on the capacity of local governments to implement innovative tools. 

Research on COVID 19 and Centre of Government presented at Governance CoP. UNDP guidance on CGF presented at the Peacebuilding Commission

Sudan, Libya, Central African Republic, Lebanon have been supported to apply CGF materials for centres of government 

In addition, in partnership with AICCRE, UN Habitat, and the Global Taskforce of Local and Regional Governments, UNDP co-organized the annual Venice Solutions bringing together over 200 local government officials from across the globe to discuss SDG Localization; Supported the 12th Global Forum on Migration and Development (GFMD), hosted by the Government of the Republic of Ecuador in January 2020, by bringing the pledges made at the Global Refugee Forum and by participating and organizing in dedicated sessions. 

Sudan, Myanmar, Thailand, and Afghanistan have been supported to apply CGF materials for local governance

Worked with PBSO on institution building and presented it at the Peacebuilding Commission 

Research started on multilevel governance and non state actors and service delivery 

UNDP participated actively in the preparation of the Global Refugee Forum, particularly by contributing as part of the co-sponsorship group on local solutions
